alert.note: Alert for Darke (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 4:21PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN DARKE COUNTY THROUGH 515 PM EDT... At 421 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 8 miles west of Winchester, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Recent report of quarter inch size hail. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Greenville, Versailles, Union City, Ansonia, Webster, Gettysburg, Osgood, North Star, Rossburg, New Weston, Yorkshire, Darke County Airport, North Dayton, Rose Hill, Cosmos, Sharpeye, Brock, State Route 47 at US Route 127, Eldora Speedway and Willowdell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
